result.execSummary:
The defendant Holden M Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

Defendant Holden M Schmidt in court with Attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire/waiver filed by Atty. Weerts and Def.
Court questions Holden Schmidt on said plea questionnaire. Def. verbally pleads no contest to counts 3 through 6. The court finds him guilty of counts 3 through 6. Court proceeds into sentencing.
Subpoena for 9/21/2016 - Jury Trial
from DA to Atty Weerts re: Additional Discovery pg's 39 & 40
State's

Final pre-trial on September 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on September 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Holden M Schmidt in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Weerts requests Court take judicial notice of DOB (12-11-97), on Nov. 10, 2014 DE was only 16 yrs old.  Burden is on the State to show valid reason for delay in charging.  DA Parker agrees that the State has this burden.  Spec. Agent JL sworn & testifies.  Exhibits 1-4 marked and id'd.   Cross-exam.  Court questions witness.  DA Parker offers Exhibits 1-4, no objection, Court accepts.  Closing statements: Atty Weerts - jurisdiction should be clear as far as age of DE, cites case law.  DA Parker  -cites Statute 938.183, argues Miller case and Montgomery case.  Court - cannot fine State deliberately stalled in prosecuting . Denies Motion.
Motion Hearing 4-1-16 Exhibits 1-4
